    • Method Detail

      • getLocationPane

        public LocationPane getLocationPane()

      • setShortcutsActive

        protected void setShortcutsActive(boolean b)
        Turn on/off special shortcuts. For example: on Mac command+D should navigate to the desktop.

      • addCancelListener

        public void addCancelListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener l)
        This is the recommended way to know when this dialog has been cancelled. If you call getCommitButton().addActionListener() you will be notified when the commit button is clicked, but some UI's might also check to see if the current file name replaces an existing file and prompt the user according.

      • addCommitListener

        public void addCommitListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener l)
        This is the recommended way to know when this dialog has been committed. If you call getCommitButton().addActionListener() you will be notified when the commit button is clicked, but some UI's might also check to see if the current file name replaces an existing file and prompt the user according.

      • fireCommitListeners

        protected void fireCommitListeners()
        This is called automatically when commitButtonPressed() returns true.

      • fireCancelListeners

        protected void fireCancelListeners()
        This is called automatically when commitButtonPressed() returns true.

      • commitButtonPressed

        protected boolean commitButtonPressed()
        This method is called when the commitButton is pressed.
        Returns:
        true this dialog should close normally. false indicates that the dialog should not close, and presumably some other action is being taken.

        For example, in a save pane if a file with this name is detected: then a subclass might prompt the user with an error dialog and return false.

      • cancelButtonPressed

        protected boolean cancelButtonPressed()
        This method is called when the commitButton is pressed.
        Returns:
        true this dialog should close normally. false indicates that the dialog should not close, and presumably some other action is being taken.

        For example, if a file with this name is detected: then a subclass might prompt the user with an error dialog and return false.

      • getBrowser

        public LocationBrowser getBrowser()

      • updateSelection

        protected void updateSelection()

      • updateNextButton

        protected void updateNextButton()
        Update the enabled state of the next button. This is automatically called when the current displayed directory changes.

      • updateBackButton

        protected void updateBackButton()
        Update the enabled state of the back button. This is automatically called when the current displayed directory changes.

      • updateUpButton

        protected void updateUpButton()
        Update the enabled state of the up button. This is automatically called when the current displayed directory changes.

      • updateNewFolderButton

        protected void updateNewFolderButton()
        Update the enabled state of the new folder button. This is automatically called when the current displayed directory changes.

      • updateComboBox

        protected void updateComboBox()
        Update the contents and enabled state of the combobox.

        Subclasses must increment the protected field "adjustingComboBox" before changing the contents/selection of this combobox, otherwise events will be inappropriately fired. (Then decrement the field again when finished.)

        This is automatically called when the current displayed directory changes.

      • updateDirectoryControls

        protected void updateDirectoryControls()
        This calls updateNextButton(), updateBackButton(), updateNewFolderButton(), updateUpButton(), and updateComboBox().

      • getCommitButton

        public javax.swing.JButton getCommitButton()

      • getCancelButton

        public javax.swing.JButton getCancelButton()

      • getNewFolderName

        protected abstract java.lang.String getNewFolderName()
        The default name for a new directory. This may prompt the user for a dialog.
        Returns:
        if this returns null then no directory should be created.

      • createNewFolder

        protected void createNewFolder()
        This is called when the user clicks the newFolderButton. The default implementation uses getNewFolderName(), possibly followed by a number if a file already exists with that name.

      • isNewFolderOpened

        protected boolean isNewFolderOpened()
        This is used in createNewFolder() to decide whether to open newly created folders, or merely select them.
        Returns:
        returns false.

      • createNewFolder

        protected void createNewFolder(IOLocation newDirectory)
        This is a convenience method to help create a new folder. This will guarantee that the directory will be visible, refresh the browser, select the newly created directory, and any other misc GUI needs.

        This is called by createNewFolder().

        Parameters:
        newDirectory - the new location to create.

      • updateProgressBar

        protected void updateProgressBar()

      • getDefaultDirectory

        public abstract IOLocation getDefaultDirectory()
        The directory this pane should open up to by default.
